pronounce/: 组合简介具体规则例子完整音标连读音标
辅音结尾失去爆破不发音get
pronounce/tutorials/: 关于这个问题，在我的印象中最深的一段经验是我刚才参加工作后不久，因为该公司的业务比较多，我又作为新人刚入职不久，需要我学习和了解的内容也很多，但是我的职责又是和公司商业战略布局有关，团队很信任我，也很需要我。我感受到了很大的压力，不仅仅是因为我需要做出更多努力来反馈团队，而且我需要转换心态来处理更多未来职场上的风险。

我记得在大学期间我参与了美国大学生数学建模大赛，我错误的预估了模型建立的算法难度，以至于没能及时解决这一问题。在比赛后的复盘中，我的队友告诉了我，这场比赛失误的地方在于因为和队友的沟通不顺利，导致模型建立的太复杂，不能很好的实现我们所提出的方案，我充分采纳了这个建议，我自己也认为在后面的类似团队协作处理问题时，应该在前期投入更多的交流，在确定好最终方案后才能正确完成好目标。因此在后面有幸又参与到数学建模大赛，在这次中，我们团队取得了好的成绩。
我通常会选择用动起来的方式来排解我的工作压力，比如我会选择跑步或者跳舞。因为在我动起来的过程当中，我的脑子只专注于我当前的动作，这段期间，我的大脑处于了休息的状态，并且在运动后，洗一个热水澡，好好的睡一觉，也有利于我第二天更专注于我所做的工作。

这个词的口型逐渐由小变大，那么
这几个单词的时候，要充分感受嘴型的从小到大的变化。/iː/
pronounce/works/day56.html: 一旦我毕业离开了你，谁来照顾你？
是谁叫你焊接电路的？还有编程、法式编发？投出旋转球？是我，都是我教的。

basic/phonetic-alphabet.html.title: phonetic-alphabet
basic/phonetic-alphabet.html.body:
音标

参考自牛津字典标准：https://dictionary.cambridge.org/help/phonetics.html




音标
例词

音标
例词




元音


[i]
seat, reed, rear

[ɪ]
kit, built, hymn


[eɪ]
rate, rain, break
[ɛ]
bet, bread, bare


[æ]
sat, half, laugh
[ɑ]
lock, what, hard


[ɔ]
dog, law, talk
[oʊ]
boat, rope, toe


[ʊ]
put, look, wolf
[ʉ]
root, tube, group


[ʌ]
cut, son, flood
[ɔɪ]
coil, toy, boy


[aɪ]
tight, rice, sky
[aʊ]
lout, down, bough


[ɚ]
hurt, chirp, perk
[ə]
about, circus, complete


[ən]
taken, button, open
[əl]
label, paddle, toggle


辅音


[p]
perk, pay, happy

[b]
bay, book, rabbit


[t]
tail, button, locked
[d]
dear, add, filled


[k]
key, catch, quite
[g]
game, ghost, guest


[m]
male, mock, climb
[n]
nail, knife, gnat


[ŋ]
think, sing, tongue
[h]
help, hit, who


[f]
fee, phone, laugh
[v]
veal, vary, of


[θ]
thick, throw, bath
[ð]
other, then, bathe


[s]
send, cell, scent
[z]
rose, gives, zoo


[ʃ]
shell, niche, mission
[ʒ]
garage, vision, azure


[r]
core, hard, real
[l]
let, land, tell


[w]
wit, where, quick
[j]
yes, onion, year

pronounce/.title: pronounce
pronounce/.body:
发音
符号解析



符号
说明
示例




加粗字体
重读



~
同化现象
taught~you


-
连读
write-a


↑
升调
shall we↑



连读策略
l + 元音（多 “了”） all of
n + 元音（多 “呢”）an apple
r + 元音（多 “若”）your eyes
t + 元音（变 d）out (d) of
相同辅音（读一个）bus stop
爆破音 + 辅音（憋住气）look good
/i/ + 元音（多 /j/）see (j) us
/u/ + 元音（多 /w/）do (w) it
t + y（变 /tʃ/）meet you
d + y（变 /dʒ/）would you
s + y（变 /ʃ/）miss you

    
        组合简介具体规则例子完整音标连读音标
    
    
        1. 辅音+元音直接连读stand upfind out[ˈstænd ʌp][faɪnd aʊt]stand~upfind~out
    
    
        2. 辅音+辅音爆破音 /p/, /b/, /t/, /d/, /k/, /g/ + 辅音结尾失去爆破不发音get marriedgood luck44
    
    
        相同辅音只读一次bad dayyes sirN/Aint**
    
    
        3. 元音+元音加个滑音/i:/, /i/ + 元音：多个 /j/see offbe over-see /j/ offbe /j/ over
    
    
        /u:/, /u/ + 元音。多个 /w/do ittwo apples-do /w/ ittwo /w/ apples
    
    
        4. l n r + 元音多个音 /l/, /n/, /r/-fill inan eggyour eyes-fill /l/ inan /n/ eggyour /r/ eyes
    
    
        5. t d s + /j/变音/t/ + /j/ 变成 /tʃ/meet you-/tʃu:/
    
    
        /d/ + /j/ 变成 /dʒ/could you-/dʒu:/
    
    
        /s/ + /j/ 变成 /ʃ/miss you-/ʃu:/
    
    
        6. 省略 h 和 th（常见于 him/her/have/has 等）ifind himmy friend has

pronounce/tutorials/.title: tutorials
pronounce/tutorials/.body:
I once made a mistake on a university project by underestimating the time needed. The feedback highlighted my oversight and lack of thoroughness. In response, I learned to allocate more time for research and planning in subsequent projects.
我记得在大学期间我参与了美国大学生数学建模大赛，我错误的预估了模型建立的算法难度，以至于没能及时解决这一问题。在比赛后的复盘中，我的队友告诉了我，这场比赛失误的地方在于因为和队友的沟通不顺利，导致模型建立的太复杂，不能很好的实现我们所提出的方案，我充分采纳了这个建议，我自己也认为在后面的类似团队协作处理问题时，应该在前期投入更多的交流，在确定好最终方案后才能正确完成好目标。因此在后面有幸又参与到数学建模大赛，在这次中，我们团队取得了好的成绩。
During my time at university, I took part in the Mathematical Contest In Modeling.   I made a mistake by underestimating the complexity of the algorithm for building the model, which resulted in a delayed solution.
In the post-competition review, my teammates pointed out that the communication issues between us led to a needlessly complex model, hindering the implementation of our proposed solution.   I fully embraced this feedback.   I realized that, in similar team collaborations, effective communication in the early stages is crucial.
So, in subsequent instances, I made sure to invest more in communication before finalizing the approach.   Fortunately, I had the opportunity to participate in another mathematical modeling competition, and our team finally achieved good results.
关于这个问题，在我的印象中最深的一段经验是我刚才参加工作后不久，因为该公司的业务比较多，我又作为新人刚入职不久，需要我学习和了解的内容也很多，但是我的职责又是和公司商业战略布局有关，团队很信任我，也很需要我。我感受到了很大的压力，不仅仅是因为我需要做出更多努力来反馈团队，而且我需要转换心态来处理更多未来职场上的风险。
我通常会选择用动起来的方式来排解我的工作压力，比如我会选择跑步或者跳舞。因为在我动起来的过程当中，我的脑子只专注于我当前的动作，这段期间，我的大脑处于了休息的状态，并且在运动后，洗一个热水澡，好好的睡一觉，也有利于我第二天更专注于我所做的工作。
Talking about this issue, a standout experience for me was right after I started my new job.   The company had a lot going on, and being a new hire, there was a ton to learn and grasp.   What made it even more challenging was that my role was closely tied to the company's overall business strategy, and the team really relied on me.   That brought on some serious pressure!
It wasn't just about putting in extra effort.  I also had to shift my mindset to handle the uncertainties that come with the whole work scene.   It felt like diving into the deep end.
So, my go-to stress buster?   Getting active – whether it's a good run or a bit of dancing.   When I'm in motion, my mind is all about the moves, like a breather for my brain.   After sweating it out, a hot shower, a solid night's sleep – that combo sets me up to tackle whatever work throws at me the next day.

pronounce/tutorials/s1_front_vowel.html.body:
单元音

元音都发四声




10:20~13:20

前元音：/iː/ /ɪ/ /e/ /æ/

    
        音标
        单词
        注释
        发音
    
    
        英式
        美式
    
    
        /iː/
        bee
        n. 蜜蜂
        uk /biː/
        us /biː/

        uk /wiː/
        us /wiː/
    
    
        read
        vt. 阅读
        uk /ri:d/
        us /ri:d/
    
    
        meat
        n. 肉
        uk /miːt/
        us /miːt/

        uk /hiːt/

        seat

        uk /siːt/

        /ɪ/
        sit
        vi. 坐
        uk /sɪt/
        us /sɪt/
    
    
        fish
        n. 鱼
        uk /fɪʃ/
        us /fɪʃ/
    
    
        king
        n. 国王
        uk /kɪŋ/
        us /kɪŋ/
    
    
        win
        vi. 赢
        uk /wɪn/
        us /wɪn/
    
    
        live
        vi. 居住
        uk /lɪv/
        us /lɪv/
    
    
        hit
        vt. 打击
        uk /hɪt/
        us /hɪt/
    
    
        little
        adj. 很少的
        uk /lɪtl//
        us /lɪtl/
    
    
        
            Your browser does not support the audio element.
        
    
    
        /e/
        bed
        n. 床
        uk /bed/
        us /bed/
    
    
        pen
        n. 钢笔
        uk /pen/
        us /pen/
    
    
        bend
        n. 弯曲
        uk /bend/
        us /bend/
    
    
        dress
        n. 连衣裙
        uk /dres/
        us /dres/
    
    
        egg
        n. 蛋
        uk /eg/
        us /eg/
    
    
        red
        n. 红色
        uk /red/

            Your browser does not support the audio element.
        
    
    
        /æ/
        bad
        n. 坏人
        uk /bæd/
        us /bæd/
    
    
        lamb
        n. 羔羊
        uk /læm/
        us /læm/
    
    
        tan
        n. 棕褐色
        uk /tæn/
        us /tæn/
    
    
        ant
        n. 蚂蚁
        uk /ænt/
        us /ænt/
    
    
        pan
        n. 平底锅
        uk /pæn/
        us /pæn/
    
    
        band

        uk /bænd/
        us /bænd/

        uk /mæs/

            Your browser does not support the audio element.
        
    


💡 区分 seat sit set sat
  两个音不仅仅是“长短”的区别，甚至在美音音标中，都是没有长音符号的。中国学生一般非常擅长发 seat 这个所谓的“长音”，但实际上，根据我们前面所学的内容，seat 和 sit 的发音口型上是非常不一样的。大家先发seat，保持住sea这部分的口型，然后嘴巴张开一点，口腔内部空间更大一点，然后发出 sit。你可以这样想象，seat-sit-set-sat 这个词的口型逐渐由小变大，那么 sit 的口型应该在 seat 和 set 之间，这样就更容易区分了。

    
        单词
        音标
        发音技巧
    
    
        英式
        美式
    
    
        seatn. 座位
        uk /siːt/
        us /siːt/
        嘴巴往两边咧开发 yi 的声音
    
    
        sitv. 坐
        uk /sɪt/
        us /sɪt/
        嘴巴保持小口型不变，就像不说话在口呼吸时一样放松
    
    
        setv. 放，置
        uk /set/
        us /set/
        在上面的小口型基础上稍微张大嘴巴。可以通过舌头放松不动，嘴巴慢慢长大，持续发 `yi` 的声音，直到嘴型变大后发出的声音听起来像 `ei`，这就是这个音标最佳口型
    
    
        satv. 坐（sit 的过去式和过去分词）
        uk /sæt/
        us /sæt/
        在上面基础上再加大嘴型，使发出的 `ei` 更夸张，但又不像 `a` 这个音
    




Your browser does not support the audio element.



由于前元音是典型的口型从小变大的一个过程，/iː/ /ɪ/ /e/ /æ/，所以说在区分 seat sit set sat 这几个单词的时候，要充分感受嘴型的从小到大的变化。/iː/ /iː/ seat seat，/ɪ/ /ɪ/ sit sit，/e/ /e/ set set，/æ/ /æ/ sat sat。

pronounce/works/day1.html.title: day1
pronounce/works/day1.html.body:
句子
缩读
拟音
音频




x


Your browser does not support the audio element.


1. What are you doing?你在干什么/在干嘛？
Whader you dowinWhada you dowin




Your browser does not support the audio element.


2. Where do you live?你住哪？
Wear do you liveWer do you live




3. Where are you going?你去哪？
Where er you gowinWhere you gowin




4. I don't know.我不知道。
I don' knowI dunno




5. I'm not sure.我不确定。
I'm no'sher




6. Makes sense.有道理。
Make sense




7. How do you feel?感觉如何？
Ha da you feel




8. How's it going?你好吗？
Hauzi' gowin




9. Pretty good.挺好的。
Preddy good
pre滴 搁的




10. Doesn't matter.无所谓。
Dozen madder




11. I don't care about it.我不在乎这个。
I don' care aboudit




12. What do you think?你觉得呢？
whada ya think




13. I didn't catch that.我没听清。
I didn' catch tha'




14. Let me tell you something.我跟你说
Lemme tell ya somethin




15. You've got to be kidding me.你在逗我吗？
Youv go'ta be kidding meYou godda be kidding me




16. Check it out.你看！/听着
Checki'dout
切k daot



17. What have you been up to?最近在忙什么？
Whadav you beenupto
蛙 打五优 奔英拿谱吐



18. You're looking good.你看着不错。
Yer lookin' good




19. Let's talk about it.我们聊聊吧。
Lets talkaboudi'
累次 它ku包得



20. I really appreciate it.我很感激。
I reely appreciadi'
I rui里 epre写诶die


21. I don't believe it.我不相信。
I don' b'leevi'




22. I don't really want it.我不太想要。
I-don-reely wani'




23. Are you doing okay?你还好吗？
er you dowin' nokayya dowin' nokay
耳 u 嘟win nokey椰儿 嘟win nokey



24. Are you doing anything?你在忙吗？
er you dowin'nanything




25. I hope it is easy.希望这个很简单。
I ho-pi-dizeezy
I 齁披滴zz



26. My name is Zed.我名字是 Zed。
my nay miz-Zed
my 勒 美子 Zed



27. They're here.他们在这。
There here




28. We're good.我们没事/不用了。
Wer goo'




29. You're one of my favorites.你是我的最爱之一。
Yer one-na my favorites




30. We're out of time.我们没时间了。
Wer oudda time
屋耳 傲打 time



31. Most of my life.我一生大部分时间。
Mosta my life
某死它 my life



32. Just let me have it.就让我拥有它吧。
Jus lemme havi'

pronounce/works/day2.html.title: day2
pronounce/works/day2.html.body:
A:
Court order for asset seizure. You gotta pay your property taxes, Maddie.
B:
No, this is a mistake. I'm negotiating a payment schedule with them.
A:
Oh, well, I guess they're done negotiating.
B:
What? So, they're taking my car? I'm an Uber driver.
A:
Not my problem.
电影【不要见怪】

A:
Court-order for asset seizure. You gotta pay your property taxes, Maddie.
kuo der 哦der fer  c zir. u god pay yer ... 咩~抵
B:
No, this-is-a mistake. I'm negotiating-a ^payment schedule with them.
勒钩泄欸顶
A:
Oh, well, I guess they're ^done negotiating.
B:
What? So, they're taking my ^car? I'm an ^Uber driver.
安母恩 乌ber
A:
Not my problem.

pronounce/works/day56.html.title: day56
pronounce/works/day56.html.body:
Day 56



素材选自电影【变形金刚4：绝迹重生】

台词

  
  Your browser does not support the audio element.


Once I graduate and I'm gone, who's  gonna take care of you?

一旦我毕业离开了你，谁来照顾你？
Once-I graduate-and-I'm gone, who's gonna take care of you?

Oh, you take care of me?

是你在照顾我吗？
Oh, you take care of me↑?

Who taught you how to solder a circuit? Or write a program? Or French braid your hair? Or throw a spiral? Me. That's what I do.

是谁叫你焊接电路的？还有编程、法式编发？投出旋转球？是我，都是我教的。
Who taught~you how to solder a circuit? Or write-a program? Or French braid~your hair? Or throw a spiral? Me. That's what-I do.

Who taught you how to cook without ketchup, or balance your checkbook. Who always has to be the grownup around here?

谁教你不用番茄酱做饭的？谁教你平衡支票薄的？又是谁一直在扮演成年人的角色？
Who taught~you how to cook without ketchup, or balance~your checkbook. Who always has to be the grownup around here?
